folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Maujer Street, at the northeast corner of Leonard Street, showing Public School No. 18. The old building on the left being a new addition and occupies the above corner,

Board of Education of the City of New York June 24, 1931

folder: Leonard Street & Maujer Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1)
182-190 Leonard Street, east side, south from Maujer Street. At the N.E. corner of Leonard and Maujer Street is seen Public School No. 18.
October 25, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing demolishing to make way for the Federal Housing Program.
July 30, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Leonard Street & Maujer Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1)
182-190 Leonard Street, east side, south from Maujer Street. At the N.E. corner of Leonard and Maujer Street is seen Public School No. 18.
October 25, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing demolishing to make way for the Federal Housing Program.
July 30, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Maujer Street, south side, east from Leonard Street. No. 88 Maujer Street is the first one fronting on Maujer Street, with high steps.

October 25, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Maujer Street, at the N.E. corner of Leonard Street. A view of a section of P.S. No. 18, destroyed in 1935 under the Federal Housing Administration, to make way for a modern school.

October 25, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Leonard Street & Maujer Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1) Leonard Street, east side, between Maujer and Ten Eyck Streets, showing demolition preparatory to new apartment buildings.

July 30, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from another angle.

August 26, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Leonard Street & Maujer Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1) Leonard Street, east side, between Maujer and Ten Eyck Streets, showing demolition preparatory to new apartment buildings.

July 30, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from another angle.

August 26, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Maujer Street, south side, east from Leonard Street. (Another view no longer in existence.) These buildings were razed and new apartments built with the aid of the Federal Housing Administration.
August 26, 1935.
P. L. Sperr

folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Maujer Street, east from Leonard Street. At the left, as far as the eye can see, the old homes have been razed making way for new apartments provided for by the Federal Housing Administration. At the left is Grand Street, north side, east from Leonard Street across razed buildings. The steeple of St. Catherine's Hospital is seen at the right background.

December 22, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Maujer Street, between Leonard Street and Manhattan Ave., as seen from Leonard near Ten Eyck Streets. The 3-story brick building on the north side of Maujer Street, was a part of P.S. No. 18, and was demolished in 1934.

July 30, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1) Maujer Street, north side, between Leonard Street and Manhattan Ave., showing the new Public School No. 18 (the 4-story building at the left), and the old building adjoining it. In the foreground, east of Leonard Street, is Ten Eyck Street; also seen at the left, is Leonard Street, north from Ten Eyck Street; December 22, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a closer view of the old building of P.S. No. 18, and also in the foreground, the foundation work (on Ten Eyck Street), for low rental apartment houses, made possible by the Federal Housing Act. September 27, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, showing the rebuilding on the south side of Maujer Street, and from left to right in the background St. Johns Evangelical Lutheran Church and St. Catherine's Hospital. November 27, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

text:

folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Maujer Street, north side, between Leonard Street and Manhattan Ave., showing a northerly view towards Grand Street, and the rear of homes facing Leonard Street and Manhattan Ave. View taken from Maujer Street. These buildings were razed in 1935.

July 30, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Maujer Street, (left) east from Leonard Street, showing the foundations upon which will be erected the Federal Housing Administration sponsored apartments. Also seen from left to right, in the background, are St. John's Evang. Lutheran Church, and St. Catherine's Hospital.

August 10, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1)
Maujer Street, east from Leonard Street, sho ing at the right,partial erection of new apartment houses sponsored by the Federal Housing administration. When this reconstruction is completed, a beautiful residential district will stand on what was once the sldms of Williamsburg.
February 1, 1937.
L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing alse in the background from left to right, two steepled buildings, which are St. John's Evang. Lutheran Church and St.
Catherine's Hospital.
February 1, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, showing fully the east side of Maujer Street, partially seen in views Nos. 1 & 2. Viewed north on Leonard Street from Ten Eyck
Street, is P.S. No. 18, old and new.
February 1, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
